subject: Tennis
lead_paragraph: Hours after complaining of fatigue following her first loss of the year Friday, the Australian Open champion Maria Sharapova told officials at this week’s tournament in Miami that she was withdrawing. The $3.77 million tournament is considered a mandatory event by the WTA, meaning Sharapova could face punishment for skipping the tournament, which starts Monday. Tournament officials told The Miami Herald of Sharapova’s decision, which came after a semifinal loss to Svetlana Kuznetsova in Indian Wells, Calif., that ended her 18-match winning streak.
